page.title: 09MACHINERY AT ACKTON HALL PIT
page.content: Machinery is very useful in producing coal and bringing it to the surface. Many of the machines used in the mining industry today are high powered and expensive. An example is the{RH25 road header}which rip into the coal face and loosen tons of material, a high powered jet of water sprays round the drill to prevent sparking on the blades. Obviously such safety features are a necessity since quantities of explosive gas may be present. Also Dowty support shields 4/280T are used on difficult seams. The machinery for Ackton Hall Colliery comes from 2 places, Andersons Strathclyde PLC tunneling equipment unit or a supplier in Doncaster. The pit is due for closure and the machinery will be sent to other collieries.
